DescriptionOfIncident: Black Pudding - incorrect use by date on packaging.
RiskToConsumers: Consuming food after the intended use by date could potentially present a microbiological risk to health.

DescriptionOfIncident: French cheese - presence high levels of Listeria monocytogenes.
RiskToConsumers: Microbiological risk - presence of harmful bacteria.

DescriptionOfIncident: Sliced Wholemeal Bread - presence of small pieces of metal in product.
RiskToConsumers: Physical contamination - possible risk of metal fragments.

DescriptionOfIncident: Flavoured Ribs - incorrect storage instructions on the packaging.
RiskToConsumers: Food quality issued - presence of spoilage.

DescriptionOfIncident: Chicken tikka sandwiches, chicken tikka wraps and chicken tikka fillers and fillings - presence of Salmonella.
RiskToConsumers: Microbiological risk - presence of salmonella in the products listed.

DescriptionOfIncident: Bottles of beer - bottle might break upon opening.
RiskToConsumers: Physical contamination - possible risk of glass fragments.

DescriptionOfIncident: Chicken Tikka - presence of Salmonella in the Tikka powder used to manufacture this product.
RiskToConsumers: Microbiological risk - the potential presence of Salmonella in the products listed below. Salmonella is a bacterium that can cause food poisoning

DescriptionOfIncident: Organic Apricot Kernels - incorrect instructions for use on the label.
